intro: Cyrtandra calyptribracteata, commonly known as the Hawaiian false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bract-like structures that enclose its flowers. Cyrtandra calyptribracteata is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in montane and lowland forest ecosystems.
